intro: Piper villalobosense, commonly known as the Philippine pepper or mountain pepper, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, and the plant is often found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
